intro: Elmerrillia tsiampacca var. glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth-leaved elmerrillia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical or subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
